newsitem.title: UK: Bell Cablemedia to buy Videotron's UK co.
newsitem.headline: Bell Cablemedia to buy Videotron's UK co.

text.p: Bell Cablemedia said on Tuesday it had conditionally agreed to buy 56 percent of Videotron Groupe's UK company, Videotron Holdings Plc, in addition to the 26 percent it already owns.

After buying the Canadian company's stake in Videotron Holdings, Bell Cablemedia said it would make an unconditional offer to buy all of the UK unit's public and employee shares for $19.75 cash per Videotron American Depositary Share.
The company said the offer represented a premium of 12.9 percent to the closing price of $17.50 per Videotron share and would value Videotron at $1.09 billion.

Bell Cablemedia also said that on completion of the deal, Cable and Wireless Plc would subscribe $338 million in cash for about 91.1 million Bell Cablemedia ordinary shares at the equivalent of $18.55 per Bell Cablemedia ADS.
Following the subscription, Cable and Wireless and Bell Canada International will each hold some 32.5 percent of Bell Cablemedia.
Jones Intercable Inc and certain affiliates will hold some 10.4 percent. Public shareholders of Bell Cablemedia will hold the balance of about 24.6 percent, the company said in its statement.
Cable and Wireless had undertaken not to exercise voting rights in Bell Cablemedia in excess of 29.9 percent, it said.

Bell Cablemedia said it would finance the proposed acquisition of Videotron Holdings, a UK television cable network operator, with proceeds from the subscription and a short-term bridge facility amounting to $425 million.
The balance would be paid with existing resources, the company said.
Bell Cablemedia said it would pay $607 million in cash for Videotron Groupe's 56 percent stake in Videotron Holdings.
The company said it was being advised on the proposed acquisition of Videotron by Salomon Brothers and NatWest.
